Chapter Outline 15-8 Time-Weighted Charts 15-8.1 Cumulative Sum Control Chart 15-1 Quality Improvement and Statistics 15-8.2 Exponentially Weighted Moving-15-1.1 Statistical Quality Control Average Control Chart 15-1.2 Statistical Process Control 15-9 Other SPC Problem-Solving Tools 15-2 Introduction to Control Charts 15-2.1 Basic Principles 15-10 Decision Theory 15-2.2 Design of a Control Chart 15-10.1 Decision Models 15-2.3 Rational Subgroups 15-10.2 Decision Criteria 15-2.4 Analysis of Patterns on 15-11 Implementing SPC Control Charts

note: A very well-written presentation of graphical methods in statistics.
title: Graphical Methods for Data Analysis

note: An excellent introduction to statistical thinking, requiring minimal mathematical background.
title: Statistics

note: Good discussion and illustration of techniques such as stem-and-leaf displays and box plots.
title: Understanding Robust and Exploratory Data Analysis
Statistics: A Guide to the Unknown
Contains a collection of short nonmathematical articles describing different applications of statistics
Exploratory Data Analysis
Introduces many new descriptive and analytical methods. Not extremely easy to read
Introduction to Probability Theory
A well-written and comprehensive treatment of probability theory and the standard discrete and continuous distributions
Probability Models and Applications
A comprehensive treatment of probability at a higher mathematical level than this book
Probability with Statistical Applications
A precalculus introduction to probability with many excellent examples
A First Course in Probability
More mathematically sophisticated than this book, but has many excellent examples and exercises
Introduction to Mathematical Statistics
Another classic work on the mathematical principles of statistics; higher level than the Hoel book, but contains excellent discussions of estimation and hypothesis testing
Introduction to Mathematical Statistics
Written at a relatively low mathematical level, very readable
Introduction to Probability Theory and Statistical Inference
An extremely well-written book that gives broad coverage to many aspects of probability and mathematical statistics
Probability and Statistics for Engineering and the Sciences
Covers many of the same topics as this text, but at a slightly higher mathematical level. Many of the examples and exercises involve applications to biological and life sciences

note: Covers many of the same topics as this book. More emphasis on probability and a higher mathematical level.
title: Probability and Statistics in Engineering and Management Science

note: More tightly written and mathematically oriented than this book, but contains some good examples.
title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists

note: A very wellwritten book at about the same level as this one. Regression Analysis
title: Probability and Statistics for Engineers and Scientists
Fitting Equations to Data
An excellent reference containing many insights on data analysis

note: A comprehensive book on regression written for statistically oriented readers.
title: Applied Regression Analysis
Applied Linear Statistical Models
The first part of the book is an introduction to simple and multiple linear regression. The orientation is to business and economics

note: A comprehensive book on regression written for engineers and physical scientists.
title: Introduction to Linear Regression Analysis

container-title: Very well written. Design of Experiments
title: Classical and Modern Regression with Applications
Contains many examples with annotated SAS output
Statistics for Experimenters
An excellent introduction to the subject for those readers desiring a statistically oriented treatment. Contains many useful suggestions for data analysis
Statistical Design and Analysis of Experiments
A comprehensive book covering basic statistics, hypothesis testing and confidence intervals, elementary aspects of experimental design, and regression analysis

note: Written at the same level as the Box, Hunter, and Hunter book, but focused on engineering applications.
title: Design and Analysis of Experiments
Practical Nonparametric Statistics
An excellent exposition of the methods of nonparametric statistics; many good examples and exercises
Nonparametric Statistical Methods
A good reference book, with a very useful set of tables

author.family: Statistical Quality Controland Related Methods Duncan

note: A classic book on the subject.
title: Quality Control and Industrial Statistics
Statistical Quality Control
One of the first books on the subject; contains many good examples
Statistical Methods in Engineering and Quality Improvement
Not a methods book, but a well-written presentation of statistical methodology for quality improvement
Introduction to Statistical Quality Control
A modern comprehensive treatment of the subject written at the same level as this book
Applied Life Data Analysis

Contains many examples of using statistical methods for the study of failure data; a good reference for the statistical aspects of reliability engineering and the special probability distributions used in that field

note: Gives broad coverage of the field, with some emphasis on newer techniques.
title: Statistical Methods for Quality Improvement
Modern Methods for Quality Control and Improvement
A comprehensive treatment of statistical methods for quality improvement at a somewhat higher level than this book
Statistical Quality Control Handbook, Western Electric Company
